annotations.title: Annotations Module
annotations.description: The annotations module includes a set of Spring-oriented annotations to make it easier to manage some AWE features.

api/accordion.title: Accordion
api/accordion.description: An accordion is a layout component that allows to organize the content in different sections that can be collapsed or expanded.  Inside its panels, it allows to have the same content as a window or a tag element, even nested accordions.

api/actions.title: Actions
api/actions.description: To perform an action when we click a button, or a dependency is activated, we need to define a button-action or a dependency-action. The format of these actions is the next one:

api/button.title: Button
api/button.description: A button is a graphical control element that provides the user a simple way to trigger an event, like searching for a query, or to interact with dialog boxes, like confirming an action.

api/chart.title: Charts
api/chart.description: AWE uses Highcharts library for chart development. This javascript library allows build many types of dynamic graphics easily, quickly and flexibly. It has no dependencies on any other library. It´s compatible with most current browsers and has high performance.

api/context-menu.title: Context menu
api/context-menu.description: Awe engine allows define context menu inside a grid, criterias or charts. With these menus, you can add functionality to your window.

api/criteria.title: Criteria
api/criteria.description: Criteria elements are window components which can get input from the user and send it to the application server (business logic).

api/dependencies.title: Dependencies
api/dependencies.description: Each component (criterion, grid, chart, etc) can have some dependencies inside affecting its behaviour and contents. A dependency can be launched depending on component conditions or events.

api/dialog.title: Dialog
api/dialog.description: A dialog is a graphical item that provides the functionality of showing a modal window with a selected message and title (and an icon, if you want). A dialog should be associated to a button-action with type "dialog" (See button actions).

api/email.title: Email definition
api/email.description: Note: All emails are defined in the Email.xml file at global folder. View project structure  for more info.

api/enumerate.title: Enumerate definition
api/enumerate.description: Enumerated components are structures to define label - value lists. They are useful i.e. for translations.

api/grids.title: Grids
api/grids.description: Grids are the main component in AWE to show data lists. It is defined by grid and columns:

api/i18n-internationalization.title: i18n-internationalization
api/i18n-internationalization.description: AWE implements a i18n system for internationalization of web applications. For this reason, AWE uses locale files containing literals in different languages.

api/icons.title: icons
api/icons.description: AWE has included some icons families to be used on components and grids.

api/include.title: Include
api/include.description: An include is a component which allows you to pick a screen piece and place it inside another screen. It's very useful to reuse a piece of code between screens.

api/info.title: Navigation Bar
api/info.description: The navigation bar is used to add visual elements with logic functions in the top zone of application. This part is displayed in all application screens.

api/layout.title: Layout
api/layout.description: AWE layout service helps the developer to position the screen layers taking advantage of all the screen size. There are two ways of 'expanding' the layout:

api/maintain.title: Maintain definition
api/maintain.description: The maintain engine is used to do operations that don't return data. These operations are valid for updating data in the server. They only return the result of proccess, if operation has been ok or if there has been a problem while doing the operation.

api/menu.title: Menu definition
api/menu.description: Navigation menu for an AWE application is defined in XML files. The two menu XML files are:

api/messages.title: Messages
api/messages.description: Message elements are messages to show after execute one action. Usually these message are described in the hidden section of the window.

api/pivot-table.title: Pivot Table
api/pivot-table.description: The pivot table is an analytic component which allows the user to generate custom reports from a dataset, and play with those data in several ways.

api/query.title: Query definition
api/query.description: The AWE query engine is used for querying data on external systems. It works as an interface.

api/queues.title: Queues definition
api/queues.description: The AWE Jms engine allows integration with queue servers. Both JMS typologies, point to point and publish/subscribe.

api/resizable.title: Resizable
api/resizable.description: A resizable is a container which can be resized grabbing one of its sides.

api/screen.title: Screen Element
api/screen.description: The screen is the container tag for all screen components. In this tag you have to define the JSP template the screen is going to render, the screen title (label), and some other features like the target, which is a list of queries to launch that will fill the criteria values.

api/screens.title: Screen Definition
api/screens.description: In AWE, screens are generated by an XML descriptor and a JSP template. HTML final pages are generated automatically based in those 2 files.

api/service.title: Services Definition
api/service.description: Service operations are designed to perform specific treatments and calculations out of the AWE utilities.

api/tab-and-tabcontainer.title: Tab and tabcontainer
api/tab-and-tabcontainer.description: A tab is a very useful screen component to separate the screen components in tabs:

api/tags.title: Tag
api/tags.description: Tags are basically HTML elements. They can be used to separate the different parts of the screen we want to generate.

api/template.title: Template
api/template.description: A template is a JSP file which contains a link between the AWE engine and the XML descriptor. Those links are called source points. Each JSP template has one or more source points. These source points are the places where our generated code in the XML descriptor will be located once each page is generated.

api/window.title: Window
api/window.description: A window is a container with a title bar. It also can be maximized or restored, and it's very useful to sort groups of components in the screen.

application-options.title: Application Options
application-options.description: Application options are a way to add property values via database. Application options

builder.title: Builder Module
builder.description: Builder module is a set of Java utilities designed to cover some functionalities:

database-migration.title: Database migration
database-migration.description: AWE uses Flyway as default tool for database script version control.

developer.title: DevTools Module
developer.description: This module has some very useful management tools to manage literals:

developer-tools.title: DevTools Module
developer-tools.description: This module has some very useful management tools to manage server resources:

guides/dependency-task.title: Dependencies between tasks
guides/dependency-task.description: Another powerful feature of the Scheduler module is the possibility of adding dependencies to a task. The dependencies are tasks that will be launched just after the parent task finishes. These dependencies can also contain other dependencies, creating a workflow.

guides/notifier.title: Notifications
guides/notifier.description: The notifier module improves AWE with a notification system. This system works the following way:

guides/print-engine.title: Print engine
guides/print-engine.description: AWE has a generic printing engine in order to print the content of a screen. This printing engine allows printing the content of a screen in pdf, excel and doc formats.

guides/project-structure.title: Project Structure
guides/project-structure.description: AWE (Almis Web Engine) is a web application development tool which allows the developer to create web application screens by describing the screen behaviour on a XML file.

guides/schedule-configuration.title: Schedule Tasks Configuration
guides/schedule-configuration.description: The scheduler is a powerful tool which allows to create any kind of schedule in a simple way.

guides/scheduler.title: Scheduler
guides/scheduler.description: This document gives a minimum base to start with the AWE Scheduler module, and explains how to automate and schedule tasks inside AWE in a simple way.

guides/selenium-testing.title: Selenium Tests
guides/selenium-testing.description: This document gives a basic insight on how to start developing Selenium tests for applications developed with AWE. Before starting test development, make sure to read the Selenium Test Development Guide, specially the Optimization/Help tips section. Basic aspects you should know before starting to develop Selenium tests, such as general configurations and integration with Jenkins, are not treated in this document.

guides/validation.title: Validation
guides/validation.description: The validation action checks the conditions of each criterion with a value under the validation attribute. This action is related with a validate type button (see button actions).

installation.title: Installation
installation.description: To install an AWE-based application just deploy it on an application server, like Apache Tomcat, Wildfly (old JBoss) or IBM WebSphere

intro.title: Almis Web Engine
intro.description: AWE is a light-weight Java web framework. Allows you build web applications in the fastest way.

logging.title: Logging
logging.description: AWE framework uses Logback for all internal logging but you can configure your project to use other libraries like JUL or Log4j2.

maven.title: Maven
maven.description: The maven dependencies needed to run an application with AWE engine are the next ones:

notifier.title: Notifier Module
notifier.description: The notifier module allows your users to subscribe to notifications in your application.

rest.title: Rest API Module
rest.description: What's a REST api? REST stands for Representational State Transfer. (It is sometimes spelled "REST".) It

scheduler.title: Scheduler Module
scheduler.description: Scheduler module adds a powerful scheduling tool to your application

session.title: Session config
session.description: AWE allows developers to configure the application session in two ways: Using the default HttpSession (Basic session)

training/awe-102.title: awe-102 Windows design
training/awe-102.description: In this tutorial we will learn how to create screens with AWE and to layout the components needed for the screen as we wish.

training/awe-103.title: awe-103 Criteria, grids and charts
training/awe-103.description: The criteria elements are screen components that can be used by a user to insert and select sets of data and send them to the server. They are also used to filter the data shown in the screen and to introduce or modify data.

training/awe-104.title: awe-104 Data retrieval and manipulation
training/awe-104.description: The retrieval of data using AWE can be done from different sources: enumerated, queries, queues, services (Java and C), etc. This helps the integration of client side with the bussiness logic hosted in the server.

training/awe-105.title: awe-105 Develop module
training/awe-105.description: Developer module offers a series of tools designed to facilitate developer's tasks.

training/awe-106.title: awe-106 Actions and dependencies
training/awe-106.description: In this tutorial we will see how to give some dynamism to the screen that we have developed. Thanks to actions and dependencies it is possible to make requests to the server, to modify the content of a component given the values of other components or to change the attributes of a criteria.

training/awe-107.title: awe-107 Services
training/awe-107.description: Services within AWE are useful to execute any kind of bussiness logic on the server side. It can execute Java or C code to do whatever task we want to.
